title: language_tesT_4_15
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 15?

![dropdown:Drop_Down_723_102] your firm has a reputation for friendly service, quality products, and timely delivery, the position at Signs and Banners appears to be an excellent fit for me.
feedback: The correct answer is "Because." The sentence should read: “Because your firm has a reputation for friendly service, quality products, and timely delivery, the position at Signs and Banners appears to be an excellent fit for me.” This question asks you to pick an appropriate subordinating conjunction—or dependent clause word. The word “because” makes sense. The position seems promising to Maria because the company provides friendly service, quality products, and timely delivery.
